jobDescription: Job Summary  Visualizes, creates and maintains compliance and privacy materials and documentation to demonstrate compliance program effectiveness ; exercises independent judgment and strategies for developing compliance metrics, benchmarking, tracking, trending, training and communications; creates complex Excel and PowerPoint documents for educational and reporting purposes, including charts, graphs and other pictorial representations; develops and updates content for the compliance website; performs compliance project management activities; and maintains and updates compliance and privacy policy manuals. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Contributes to the achievement of Compliance and Privacy Department goals and objectives and adheres to departmental policies, procedures and standards; complies with organizational policies and procedures, governmental laws and regulations and accreditation standards  Effectively maintains collaborative working relationships to achieve increased satisfaction with and participation in the compliance and privacy program  Visualizes, creates and maintains compliance and privacy materials related to compliance program effectiveness, training, education, communication, awareness and reporting  Develops and maintains tools, reports, data, metrics, benchmarking, tracking, trending and archiving for compliance program effectiveness purposes  Creates and maintains complex Excel PowerPoint documents for educational and reporting purposes, including charts, graphs and other pictorial representations  Manages archiving of compliance and privacy materials, including educational, planning, reporting and communication materials  Develops and maintains content for the Compliance website  Maintains and updates compliance and privacy policy manuals  Maintains a fundamental understanding of compliance laws and regulations  May accompany Compliance and Privacy Department leadership or represents the Compliance and Privacy Department at organizational meetings as assigned  Annually identifies specific needs for self-development and implements a plan to achieve professional growth  Participates in periodic compliance and privacy program strategic planning and effectiveness evaluations  Participates in other projects as assigned and completes tasks within requested timeframes  Performs other related job functions as assigned  Equal Opportunity Employer Stanford Health Care (SHC) strongly values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity and non-discrimination in all of its policies and practices, including the area of employment. Accordingly, SHC does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation or gender identity and/or expression, religion, age, national or ethnic origin, political beliefs, marital status, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or disability, or the perception of any of the above. People of all genders, members of all racial and ethnic groups, people with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal convictions will be considered after an individualized assessment of the conviction and the job requirements.Minimum Qualifications  Education and Experience: Bachelor"s Degree in healthcare or business field from an accredited college or university  Licenses and Certifications: None required.  Preferred Qualifications: Certification in Healthcare Compliance (CHC from HCCA) preferred. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Knowledge of: Advanced knowledge of computer applications, such as Excel, Access, Word, Visio and PowerPoint  Knowledge of general compliance laws and regulations Ability to: Ability to communicate effectively, including excellent verbal and written communication skills  Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels and varying backgrounds within and outside the organization  Ability to plan, organize, prioritize multiple tasks and work independently to meet deadlines  Ability to use excellent professional judgment #LI-RL1 ~LI~
